data.meta_description: Gaming news, reviews, previews, and coverage from around the world focused around Square Enix
data.text:
Final Fantasy XI's August 2024 update is available today and refreshes Ambuscade objectives along with a few system-related updates. Chapter 1 of Ambuscade will have players face off against Meebles, and Chapter 2 will feature Morbols.Meebles will have elemental attacks after a certain time, and Barspells will be helpful. Urchin adds will appear during the encounter and will use Souleater followed by Hundred Fists if you don't take them down quickly. Jody, Julika, and Vivian from the morbol idol group SHINING BLESS return. Gear from the Rage set can now be stored on Storage Slip 31 via the Porter Moogle, and the quest menu will no longer have Vana'Bout available to select outside of the given event period or if you don't yet qualify to participate. The team has also resolved an issue where you can't heal when in possession of black or grey abyssite key items while in their corresponding areas. In other FFXI news, the June iteration of the Login Campaign is active through September 4, 2024, and upon logging in you'll earn points that can be spent on a variety of items. This month's featured item is Kupon A-AGK, a token that can be exchanged for items

In a new look at Dragon Quest III's HD2D remake, Square Enix shares information on newly added scenes as well as locations players will travel to on their journey. Several scenes involving the protagonist's father Ortega have been added to impart a better understanding of the character, and new bosses will be encountered. The team also provides a look the places you'll visit, including a port town, an island nation ruled by a leader with strange powers, and a desert kingdom ruled by a beauteous queen. Dragon Quest III HD2D is planned for release on November 14, 2024 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch and PC via Steam. The recent release date trailer also reveals that HD2D remakes of Dragon Quest I and Dragon Quest II will be coming next year to round out the "Erdrick Trilogy" of series entries. Square Enix shares the following: New Episodes Focusing on Ortega's Journey and More This remake contains several new scenes which shine a spotlight on the protagonist's father, Ortega, giving players a better understanding of the man himself and his quest. The story also features new, formidable foes which will give fans an even more enriching experience of the DRAGON QUEST III narrative. Below

Good news for folks who prefer physical game releases - Square Enix is putting the Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster series back on the menu for PlayStation 4 and Nintendo Switch starting on October 8 after it sold out last year. The collection can be pre-ordered starting today as a physical boxed product and contains all six Final Fantasy Pixel Remaster games from I through VI. This new release will come packed with an exclusive sticker set featuring the pixel characters. These versions of the games offer up unique features including the option to choose between the rearranged and original soundtracks. There's also an in-game font selection option, and boost features available - such as the ability to disable random encounters and customizing an experience multiplier. The Anniversary Edition is going for $74.99 for the whole lot, and can be pre-ordered now at select retailers.

Final Fantasy VII Ever Crisis has a new story update due out August 7, 2024 (7:00pm Pacific) for iOS, Android, and Steam. This update includes a new chapter for the Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII scenario, which follows the events of the spinoff starring Zack Fair. The free-to-play gacha-style RPG includes stories from through the FF VII universe, including new ones. This chapter follows Zack after a fateful confrontation with ex-SOLDIER Angeal Hewley, where he winds up in the Sector 5 slums church. Here he meets Aerith Gainsborough, a local florist who resides nearby. After their chance encounter, Zack returns to the Shinra building in pursuit of Genesis Rhapsodos, another SOLIDER operative gone AWOL and plotting against the company. Alongside the story update comes the Critical Threat: Behemoth Steward event, where players can earn limited time weapons and character-specific weapon parts through August 21st. The seasonal story A Fireworks Nocturne is currently ongoing through August 19th, which has its own limited-time rewards. Catch the trailer below: Crisis Core Final Fantasy VII — Chapter 4: "Encounters" https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gKx_EI6arKs

Final Fantasy XIV’s fifth expansion Dawntrail marks a turning point for the MMORPG after tying the bow strings on a decade-spanning adventure. No longer is the entire universe in impending peril, and our player character, an adventurer of great renown, is on the road once again. A contest of succession is underway in Tural, and one of its participants, Wuk Lamat, drafts you and several of your Scion friends to her team - a perfect excuse to sate your adventurer’s heart by visiting new lands and people. Tural, a land with myriad cultures inspired by indigenous populations of South and North America, has achieved a certain peace through unity, forged by the Dawnservant, Wuk Lamat’s adoptive father. During the rite of succession, you take on the role of a mentor to guide Wuk Lamat, whose journey intimately mirrors your own. Thankfully, in the opening weeks of Dawntrail’s operation, I’ve had very few issues logging in to play, even during peak hours. It’s the stark opposite of Endwalker’s launch, where, unless you were logging in during the wee morning hours, you’d be sitting in an endless login queue. The Make-it-Rain Campaign limited-time seasonal event returns to Final Fantasy XIV from August 8th, 2024 through August 26th, 2024. Subtitled "Everybody Say, Uchiwasshoi!", a short scenario quest will be available in game with a variety of seasonal rewards. Limited time items from previous years' iterations of the event can also be purchased from the Online Store at a discount. Take a look at the event details below, and, while you're here, check out the details from the latest patch 7.05, which added the Savage difficulty tier of the Arcadion raid, a new treasure dungeon, job balances, and more. "With fireworks in the air and festive decorations on every street corner, the season of summer is in full swing. So long as the sun shines bright, there is time yet for further merriment, and Costa del Sol's sandy beaches beckon... Bring your friends, family, and pets to revel and rampage at this year's Moonfire Faire!" Quest Fire Red, Beast Green Location: Speak to Mayaru Moyaru in Limsa Lominsa - Upper Decks. (X: 11.5, Y:13.8)Requires: Level 30, travel to Limsa Lominsa. Today, Square Enix shares a closer look at more character classes, battle features, and gameplay systems for Romancing SaGa 2 Revenge of the Seven, a full 3D remake of the original 1993 Super Famicom RPG. During your adventure you'll be able to recruit various characters that have a class they belong to. These classes determine what skills and weapons they are proficient in, and how they will grow as you use them on your team. Classes have abilities that you can unlock, and boons are passive abilities that include everything from enhanced stats to increased item drop rates. Mastering abilities can them be equipped to other classes independent of the one they originated. Battles will take advantage of pre-emptive strikes in the field, and United Attacks can be used by two or more characters - up to five eventually. The Overdrive gauge will build and carry between battles, and is used to execute United Attacks. Your empire can recruit a Smithy who can upgrade your equipment, even re-forge them into stronger forms using materials you find afield. Final Fantasy XIV 7.05 is out today, kicking off the race for World First in the Savage difficulty mode of the Arcadion raid's Light-heavyweight Division. Teams around the globe are competing for the fastest clear time of all four highly challenging boss encounters. As of this writing, four teams have crossed the finish line and, remarkably, the two top pairs are within seconds of each other - marking the closest race ever in the game's history. In today's patch, players can now start collecting Allagan tomestones of heliometry, which can be exchanged for item level 720 Quetzalli gear. Up to 450 of these tomestones can be obtained per week, so it will take several weeks to collect all pieces. The Tomestone vendor Zircon now has this gear available for exchange in Solution Nine's Nexus Arcade. A new treasure hunting dungeon has been added: Cenote Ja Ja Gural. Like previous iterations, the dungeon can be accessed by using br'aaxskin treasure maps to locate treasure in the overworld, and have the chance of revealing a hidden entrance to the instance. Players will often coordinate through the party finder or otherwise to hunt treasure together to maximize the group's haul. treasure hunt dungeon Cenote Ja Ja

Square Enix has launched a demo for Visions of Mana, set to release August 29th for PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC via Steam and the Microsoft Store. The demo includes a sampling of the game's story, battles, and exploration. If you play the demo, you'll unlock weapons for the protagonist Val in the full game, including: the small sword Gladius, the great sword Falx and the lance Horn Lance. The Gladius will unlock once Val becomes playable in Chapter 1, while the Falx and Horn Lance weapons unlock when you obtain the wind and moon classes respectively. While you're here, check out the latest trailer that highlights the Elemental spirits you'll encounter as well as the game's director and producer's comments on adapting them in a new way for the latest entry in the long-running Mana series. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AHIJtLufSsM
